text: Theorem Any context-free language is generated by a context-free grammar in Chomsky normal form. proof (idea) We can convert any CFG G into Chomsky normal form in 4 stages: 1. Weadd new start variable S, and the rule S > S, where S is was the original start variable 2. Removal of c-rules: we remove A — e (where A is not start variable) by replacing each occurrence of an A on the right-hand side of a rule with a new rule with that occurrence deleted. Example1: B > uAvAw becomes B > uAvAw | uvAw | uAvw | uvw Example2: B > A becomes B > € continues in the next page…
